title: Vietnam prepares for moon festival with lantern parade
description:
(1 Oct 2017) A colourful lantern parade lit up the streets of Tuyen Quang in northern Vietnam on Sunday ahead of the popular Mid-Autumn, or Moon Festival. 
The lanterns were inspired by characters of folklore and modern figures, from common household animals to Vietnam's endangered red-crowned cranes. 
The festival is held on the full moon of the eighth month of the lunar calendar, when the moon is at its fullest and brightest.
Traditionally, the festival was held to honour the moon in the hope of ensuring a successful harvest
